definition: middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
commander (= UK and US Navy equivalent)

sentences.english: An army major ranks between a captain and a colonel.

sentences.english: A lieutenant- colonel ranks above a major.
The requests revealed internal concern about the loss from an RAF wing commander.

sentences.english: The Lieutenant - Colonel Miranda was a short, gray-faced man, who had been in the army all his life .

sentences.english: And at present Colonel Markinson is dead. Is that right?

definition: junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
